title: Headshot Crew Studio Series: John Glover Interview
summary: Peter Hurley visits photographer John Glover in Costa Mesa, CA, to discuss his journey from a corporate job to becoming a professional headshot photographer. They cover John's background, his studio setup (formerly a recording studio), his gear preferences, the challenges of running a photography business, and the value of the Headshot Crew community.

steps.action: John shares his origin story, starting as a hobbyist with a DSLR about 16-18 years ago.
John explains discovering Peter Hurley via KelbyOne while researching sports photography.
A live photoshoot demonstration showing John directing a client using continuous lighting and tethering.
steps.tool: Peter Hurley Flex Kit, Tether Tools

steps.action: Discussion on transitioning to full-time photography; John advises not to underestimate the business side like marketing and websites.
John details his camera equipment, specifically the Nikon D850.
Overview of lighting gear, focusing on the Peter Hurley Flex Kit for headshots.
Breakdown of support and software: Feisol tripod, Arca Swiss head, Tether Tools cables, and Capture One.
Discussion on the 'Find a Photographer' referral engine and the benefits of the Headshot Crew community.

key_takeaways: Don't underestimate the business and marketing aspects when transitioning to a professional photography career.
Building confidence in your workflow allows you to get the shot faster.
Community support and referral networks are invaluable for business growth.
Continuous lighting and tethered shooting are highly effective for headshot photography.
